results.title: An Ordinary half hour in the extraordinary life of Robin Beckett
results.brief_description: Produced originally for inclusion in the Melbourne University Architectural Student’s Revue, this witty satire denounces the conformity of modern urban society through the character of Robin Beckett, who lives in a rubbish bin and falls in line with other members of his social group. Reviews incidents of a day in his life. No credits available.

results.title: An Opera prepares: 'Eugene Onegin'
results.creator_credit: Bosisto Productions, Brian Bosisto, Mario Andreacchio and Lesley Hammond
results.brief_description: A film made for use in secondary schools, to show the work and preparation that is involved in staging an opera performance, in this case, “Eugene Onegin”. Shows both the behind-the-scenes preparations and a dress rehearsal. Features the South Australia Opera Company and music by the ABC Symphony Orchestra. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: An Open space secondary school at work
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, John Morris and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Shows how individual differences in students’ capacity to learn can in fact be used to benefit their intellectual growth. It gives an inside view of an Open Space School in operation, showing the advantages and day-to-day methods used in the Open Space School layout. Some of the problems which must be faced and solved by staff as well as students to promote an efficient and effective school are discussed.

results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)

results.title: An Invitation to Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist attractions found along Japan’s most representative travel route: Tokyo, Nikko, Kamakura, Hakone, Kyoto, Nara, Osaka, highlighting such places as the Great Buddha at Kamakura, the Olympic Games site and the Toshogu Shrine at Nikko. Also shows typical Japanese food, pearls, kimonos, porcelain and textiles.
